required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dental Implant Study to Evaluate Bone and Gum Dimension Changes Around Implants Placed in Different Position Into the Bone.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Changes of Hard and Soft Tissues After Epi-crestal and Sub-crestal Placement of Ankylos Dental Implants.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to test two standard of care techniques of placing dental implants, and to compare how people's bones and gums respond to two different depths at which implants are placed.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: 18 months and 30 months after implant placement.
primary_outcome.description: Changes in mid-facial bone levels to be measured by CAT scan.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of interproximal levels after loading.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 18 months and 30 months after implant placement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in buccal soft tissue level.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 18 months and 30 months after implant placement.
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by CAT scan and clinically from a fixed reference point to the mid buccal soft tissue level using a stent.

arm_group.description: Test treatment where Ankylos dental implants are placed 1.5 - 2.0 mm subcrestally.
Control treatment where the Ankylos implant will be placed at epi-crestal position (0.0 mm).
